results.title: A Methylotrophic Bacterium Growing with the Antidiabetic Drug Metformin as Its Sole Carbon, Nitrogen and Energy Source
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ is one of the most prescribed antidiabetic agents worldwide and is also considered for other therapeutic applications including @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@cancer@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Endocrine_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004700 @@@endocrine disorders@@@.

results.title: Improvement Effect of Metformin on Female and Male Reproduction in Endocrine Pathologies and Its Mechanisms
results.text_hl: The review is focused on use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MF@@@ therapy for restoration of female and male reproductive functions and improvement of pregnancy outcomes in @<m>DISEASE_Endocrine_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004700 @@@metabolic and endocrine disorders@@@.

results.title: Metformin: Is it a drug for all reasons and diseases?
results.text_hl: The environmental impact of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, a drug with no known metabolites, is another emerging issue that has been linked to @<m>DISEASE_Endocrine_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004700 @@@endocrine disruption@@@ in fish, and extensive use in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2D@@@ has also raised concerns over effects on @SPECIES_9606 @@@human@@@ reproduction.

citations.NLM: Triggle CR, Mohammed I, Bshesh K, Marei I, Ye K, Ding H, MacDonald R, Hollenberg MD, Hill MA. Metformin: Is it a drug for all reasons and diseases? Metabolism. 2022 Aug;133():155223. PMID: 35640743

results.title: Occurrence, toxic effects and removal of metformin in the aquatic environments in the world: Recent trends and perspectives.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MET@@@ is also a potential @<m>DISEASE_Endocrine_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004700 @@@endocrine disruptor@@@ in fish.

results.title: Co-occurrence, toxicity, and biotransformation pathways of metformin and its intermediate product guanylurea: Current state and future prospects for enhanced biodegradation strategy.
results.text_hl: In addition, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and its biotransformation product @CHEMICAL_guanidine_carboxamide @CHEMICAL_MESH:C029280 @@@guanylurea@@@ in aquatic environments caused certain toxic effects on aquatic organisms which include @DISEASE_Neurotoxicity_Syndromes @DISEASE_MESH:D020258 @@@neurotoxicity@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Endocrine_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004700 @@@endocrine disruption@@@, production of ROS, and @GENE_ACHE @GENE_43 @@@acetylcholinesterase@@@ disturbance in aquatic organisms.

citations.NLM: Dong L, Li S, Huang J, Li WJ, Ali M. Co-occurrence, toxicity, and biotransformation pathways of metformin and its intermediate product guanylurea: Current state and future prospects for enhanced biodegradation strategy. Sci Total Environ. 2024 Feb 22;921():171108. PMID: 38395159

results.title: Medicine designed to combat diseases of affluence affects the early development of fish. How do plastic microparticles contribute?
results.text_hl: Also, @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ together with @CHEMICAL_Polystyrenes @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011137 @@@polystyrene@@@ microparticles seem to possibly disrupt the reproduction cycle and act as @<m>DISEASE_Endocrine_System_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D004700 @@@endocrine disruptors@@@.
